subject: Ethics
title: Child Soldiers Crisis
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Child Soldiers Crisis.

hook.text: An 11-year-old boy points an AK-47 at your squad. Do you shoot a child? He'll shoot you first.

buildup.text: Over 300,000 children serve as soldiers worldwide, some as young as seven years old.

discovery.text: International law says recruiting anyone under 15 is a war crime. The ICC has convicted commanders for it.

twist.text: But the children themselves are treated as both victims and threats. Former child soldiers face rejection.

climax.text: Rehabilitation programs show most child soldiers can recoverâ€”if society lets them come home.

punchline.text: They were victims first and soldiers second. Remember that.

quiz.question: What does international law say about child soldiers?
options: Recruiting anyone under 15 is a war crime prosecutable by the ICC
Children under 18 can serve voluntarily but not in combat roles
There are no international laws specifically addressing child soldiers
